intro: Cryptantha latefissa, commonly known as the late-flowering cryptantha, is a member of the Boraginaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States, particularly California. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Cryptantha latefissa is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
